msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 298 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: R. 57; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 12 lines per page; Dimensions: 240 x 450mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1283-84 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 33: "100 R. 57. Mushaf. Aharlı krem rengi kâğıt. 450mm boy ve 240mm eninde 298 yaprak. Sahifede 130mm uzunl.[uğunda] harekeli sülüsle ve altınla üç satır ve 90mm uzunl. harekeli nesihle 12 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī eliyle 682 (1283-84) de istinsah edilmiştir. 1163 (1750) tarihinde Darüssaada ağası Beşir Ağa temellüküne girmiştir. Y. 1b, 2a sahife büyüklüğünde müzehhep iki levha. Sure başları, hızıp, secde gülleri müzehhep, cetveller yaldızlıdır. Miklep, şemse ve köşelikli, vişneçürüğü deri XVII. asır Osmanlı cildi. Miklep sırtında … لا يمسه ayeti kabartma olarak yazılıdır."

This can be translated as follows: "100 R. 57. Muṣḥaf. Cream-colored sized paper. The text area written in thuluth with gold and diacritics, [contains] 5 lines measuring 130 mm height and in naskh with diacritics [contains] 12 lines measuring 90 mm. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 682 (1283-84). It entered into the possession of the Darussaʿada agha Bashīr Agha in 1163 (1750). There are two illuminated plates in the size of [Leaf] L. 1b and 2a. Sūra beginnings, ḥizb, sajda roses are illuminated. The rule-borders are gilded. Cherrybrown 17th Ottoman leather binding with flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse) and corner pieces. … لا يمسه is embossed on the spine of the flap (miklep).”
